H0.text: Duck populations are most affected when a drought reduces the water level in a pond ecosystem that depends on the water cycle to support the animals that live in or near the pond.

H1.text: Fish are the population of animals most affected if a drought reduces the water level in a pond ecosystem that depends on the water cycle to ensure the survival of animals living in or near the pond.

H2.text: Mouse population is most affected when a drought reduces the water level in pond ecosystems that depend on the water cycle to support animals that live in or near the pond.

H3.text: Snakes would be the population of animals most affected by a drought that reduces the water level in pond ecosystems that depend on the water cycle for the survival of animals living in or near the pond.

A4.text: Freshwater fish seem particularly threatened because they often live in relatively small water bodies.

A5.text: Freshwater fish, especially if endemic to a region (occurring nowhere else), may be threatened with extinction for all these reasons, as is the case for three of Spain's ten endemic freshwater fishes.
